name: Divine Rapier
description: So powerful, it cannot have a single owner.

abilities.name: Transmute
abilities.description: Toggle on to gain bonus spell damage amplification. Toggle off to gain bonus attack damage. Item starts in this mode upon purchase.
notes: Does not interrupt the caster's channeling abilities upon toggling On/Off
The cooldown only triggers upon toggling off, not upon toggling on

abilities.name: Everlasting
abilities.description: Dropped on death, and cannot be destroyed.
notes: The rapier belongs to the player that purchased it, and is muted when held by allies. The purchasing player can manually drop or stash the Rapier freely at any time

If picked up by an enemy once, it becomes a free Divine Rapier; it now works for anyone carrying it. However, it can no longer be dropped manually, and is bound to the player that picked it up until they die

additionalInfo: This item is shown as a Team Item in the shop window when purchased by an ally
Divine Rapier drops when the wielder dies, unless they have Reincarnation
This item cannot be put into the backpack
Buying, using components in the backpack to combine Divine Rapier while the inventory is full, drops the item on the floor
Unlike other combined items, Divine Rapier cannot be disassembled within seconds after assembling it
The Courier can be used to buy a Divine Rapier, but they cannot pick Divine Rapiers up from the ground
Divine Rapier does not count towards the owner's Net Worth if it is on the ground
Divine Rapier changes owner when claimed in its free state, thus counting towards the claimer's Net Worth

states.contains: The initial state upon buying the item. Manually droppable: Yes, Drops on Death: Yes, Damage Bonus: Only for purchasing hero
The state after the item is picked up by an enemy once. Manually droppable: No, Drops on Death: Yes, Damage Bonus: The hero who claims it
